loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a 41-year- old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Jehad is a micro entreprenur working from her home. She sells accessories, blankets, clothes and many other goods.

Jehad is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase additional quantities of goods such as accessories and blankets.

Jehad is looking to purchase a car and provide her children with a good amount of money for their higher education.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: La señora Daniela  tiene como actividad  principal la elaboración y venta  de queso, ella tiene sus vacas que le proveen de leche, vive con su esposo que es profesor rural y también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, el momento de la visita se encontraba vendiendo sus quesos en una de  las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto,  esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos, en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para la compra de terreno rustico para la siembra de forraje (alfa alfa) para mejorar sus ganados y tener mejores ingresos, la Sra. Daniela es una persona joven con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por la poyo brindado.
texts.en: Daniela’s main economic activity is making and selling cheese.  She has her own cows that provide her with milk.  She lives with her husband, who is a rural school teacher and also makes a living raising cattle.  At the time of Emprender’s visit Daniela was selling her cheeses at a street market in the city of El Alto.  This activity is her family’s biggest source of income.  She and her husband are asking for a loan so they can purchase rural land on which to grow fodder (alfalfa).  This will allow them to improve the quality of their cattle and thus have better income.  Daniela has aspirations to succeed, and is grateful to the lending institution for the support it provides.

loans.use: to purchase land for growing fodder.

loans.name: Madikhoja

texts.ru: Мадиходжа женат и ответственный отец двоих маленьких детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Жена домохозяйка и присматривает за детьми. Более 2-х лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Мадиходжа запрашивает займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений, горюче-смазочных материалов и ядохимикаты.
texts.en: Madikhoja is married and is a responsible father of two small children. He is very hardworking and a purposeful man. His wife is a homemaker and looks after the children. He has been cultivating crops for more than two years. Madikhoja is asking for a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuel and lubricants and chemicals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, pesticides, fuel and lubricants.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 11 years. She describes herself to be honest and God-fearing. 

Esther operates a beauty saloon where she provides hair services such as blowdry, plaiting, etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located in a strategic business area and her primary customers are both women and men. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the varying prices of beauty products. 

Esther will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more beauty products. Her business goal is to run a hairdressing school within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a 50-year-old a business man.  He is a widower with five children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

Justus is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Justus will use the loan to buy another motorbike.  With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy a taxi car.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.en:
44-year-old Maria Elizabeth is a farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and has 5 children with ages between 4 and 20.

Maria Elizabeth has been in the business of rice farming for 20 years. She earns 8000 PHP per month doing this business. She works hard to sustain her children's education. 

Maria Elizabeth applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help her achieve a better yield.  Maria Elizabeth also hopes for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and farm inputs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Yei. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for six years. She is 30 years old, married, and has six children --  three of them are still in school. 

Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her thirds loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 1000 in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a 47-year-old single lady blessed with two children that she supports. She has been operating a bead works business for the last one and a half year, earning a monthly income of KES 19,000. 

Sophia has applied for her first loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to purchase beads and art items for her shop.  The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into poultry farming. Her future plans is to expand her business and invest for a better family living standards.

loans.use: purchase beads and other art items

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old.  He is from Nakuru and has a spare parts business that he has been running for the past 6 years. He is married to Susan and they don’t have a baby yet.

Joseph has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more spare parts for his motorbike and bicycle. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.  He hopes to open a spare parts shop in the future.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a 40-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be patient. 

Hamisi operates a retail store where he sells items such as sweets, bread, milk, etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an ideal place for business and his primary customers are both men and women.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of home products. 

Hamisi will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products to sell.  His business goal is to run a supermarket within 5 years.

loans.use: buy more soap and household products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for six years. She is 40 years old, married, and has six children -- three of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her thirds loan from BRAC.   She has requested a loan of SDG 1500 in order to purchase more charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 40-year-old a business lady.  She is married to Boniface, a farmer. They are blessed with four children.  Francisca has been a tailor for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family.

Francisca is applying for her fifth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy clothing materials.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Rosa Gerardina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive por la parroquia del Valle llamada también “San Bautista de El Valle” y está situada al sureste de Cuenca. Esta parroquia es famosa por su  producción agrícola, también su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, al comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca. El Valle tiene atractivos como la laguna de Cochapamba (llenas de totoras) y varios lugares más para visitar.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 35 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 21, 18, 16, 7, 3 de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y estudia en el colegio, sus dos siguientes hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su cuarto hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad. 

Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como la mayor parte de su tiempo pasa en casa se dedica a la cría pollos, cuyes, cerdos y conejos a los que los vende en su comunidad o en días de ferias.
 
Es socia fundadora del banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y cerdos para continuar con esta actividad.

Su meta es tener un criadero más grande para crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of El Cisne Communal Bank. She lives in El Valle parish, also called San Bautista de El Valle, which is located southeast of Cuenca. This parish is famous for its agricultural production. Also its people are devoted to raising small animals and to commerce and many work in the city of Cuenca. El Valle has attractions such as Cochapamba Lake (full of cattails) and several other places to visit.

Rosa is 35 years old and married with 5 children, ages 21, 18, 16, 7 and 3. Her oldest son works and studies at school and the two that follow work and help her financially. Her fourth son studies in a little school in the city. Her husband works in the area in construction as a bricklayer. The house is their property. 

Rosa engages in household tasks. As she spends most of her time at home, she also raises chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and rabbits, which she sells in her community and on market days.

She is a founding member of the communal bank and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs and pigs to continue with this endeavor.

Her goal is to have a larger breeding farm in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 69-year-old business lady.  She is a widow with three adult children. She has been selling cereals for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

Tabitha is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff.  She will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans to stock her business.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her grandchildren. Her hope and dream is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: buy dry maize and beans

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She operates a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children --  both of them are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase maize and cassava flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy maize and cassava flour

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 58-year-old business man.  He is married to Mildred, a farmer.  They are blessed with two children. He has been in a posho mill business as a primary business and a mixed crop farming business for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

Peter is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff.  He will use the loan to buy sacks of maize and seedlings. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: buy maize and seedlings

loans.name: Piruz

texts.en:
Piruz is 66 years old. She lives in the village of Meore Obcha in West Georgia with her husband Zurab. Piruz and Zurab are retired. 

Along with their monthly pensions, which totals 220 Laris per month, the main source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have a milk cow.  Piruz produces cheese and sells it in the local market. Also the family owns a pig and sells on average 10 piglets per month. Along with the above-mentioned, Piruz and Zurab own a vineyard with 1000 vine-trees.  Zurab produces wine and sells it in local market as well. The total average monthly income for the family is 550 Laris, including their monthly pensions. 

Piruz requested credit to purchase an additional milk cow. With two milk cows, she will be able to double the production and sales of cheese.  This will significantly increase the income for the family. They will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Kimani

texts.en:
Kinami is a 60-year-old a business man.  He is married to Nzambi, a farmer. They are blessed with six children. He has been selling cereals for the past 20 years and earns a monthly income of KES 7,500 which he uses to support his family.

Kinami is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy dry beans and maize for his business.  With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to build a store for storing the grains.

loans.use: buy dry beans and maize

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
27-year-old Mirasol is a married woman with 2 children, aged 2 and 3. She and her husband run a fishing business in Bien Unido, Bohol. Mirasol's husband operates their fishing boat. Mirasol sells her husband's catch at the market.  She works hard to improve their business and take care of her kids.

Mirasol has requested this loan to purchase a boat engine.  She hopes to earn better and be able to save for her children's future education.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 56-year-old mixed crop farmer.  She is married to Simon, a business man. They are blessed with two children. She has been in the faming business for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000 which she uses to support her family.

Alice is applying for her first loan form KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  With the anticipated profit form the business, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is 59 years old. He lives in the village of Dimi in West Georgia with his family: wife Manana and two daughters (22 and 21 years old). Roman’s younger daughter is a student and the elder one works as a hotel administrator in a nearby town. 

Roman and Manana lead the agricultural business for  the family, which is the main source of the income for the family. In particular, the family runs a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows and a calf. Manana produces cheese and sells on average 12 kilos of this product each Friday at the open market in the nearby town. Along with the dairy farm, the family owns a vineyard with 1200 vine-trees. Roman produces wine and sells it in the village.  The total average monthly income for the family is 1000 Laris. 

Roman requested credit to purchase a tractor. He will cultivate the land owned by the family where vegetables will be grown. Roman will sell the harvested vegetables. Also, Roman will use the tractor to provide seasonal agricultural services to local farmers. This will significantly increase the income for his family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: purchase a tractor

loans.name: Ingoboka / Nyng Group

texts.fr:
Shafi fait partie du groupe Habimvugano. Il a 56 ans et il est marié, avec 7 enfants de 19 ans à 34 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Il a 2 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Shafi est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter, des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilise des semences de race améliore. Dans les prochaines années, Shafi voudrait être un grand agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Shafi is part of the group Habimvugano. He is 56 years old and married, and he has seven children, from 19 to 34 years old. Two of the children are in school. He has two other children  to support aside from his own. He has a fifth grade education.

Shafi is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor. 

His strategy for the growth of this business is to use improved types of seeds. In the next few years, Shafi would like to be a major farmer in his region. He plans on using the profits for paying his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine to sell.

loans.name: Julia Evangelina

texts.es:
La Señora Julia es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive por la parroquia del Valle llamada también “San Bautista de El Valle” que está situada al sureste de Cuenca. Esta parroquia es famosa por su producción agrícola, también su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, al comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca. El Valle tiene atractivos como la laguna de Cochapamba (llenas de totoras) y varios lugares más para visitar.

Doña Julia tiene 43 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 17 y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y su segundo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando, pero ya está en construcción su casa propia.
 
La Señora. Julia labora cuidando el ganado de su mamá de domingo a domingo, esta actividad la realiza hace un año. En su casa cría cerdos, pollos y cuyes.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y  lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, pollos y cuyes.
 
Su meta es terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of El Cisne Communal Bank.  She lives in the parish of El Valle, known also as San Bautista de El Valle, located to the southeast of Cuenca.  This parish is famous for its agricultural production.  The people also work raising animals and in business, and many work in the city of Cuenca.  El Valle has attractions such as the lakes of Cochapamba (full of totora reeds) and various other places to visit.

Julia, 43, is married and has two children, ages 17 and 15, from her marriage.  Her first child works and helps her financially and her second child is studying in a high school in the city.  Her husband works in agriculture.  She does not have her own house so she rents, but her own house is already under construction.

Julia works taking care of her mother's livestock from Sunday through Sunday.  She has been doing this work for a year.  At home she raises pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs.

She is in her second cycle in the communal bank, and she is going to invest it in buying pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs.

Her goal is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Maximiana

texts.en:
Maximiana earns a living through fishing. She is 41 years old, married, and has 7 children aged between 3 and 17. Maximiana's husband is a fisherman.

Maximiana has been engaged in fishing for 20 years. She and her husband work together to improve their business and sustain their family.  Maximiana said she ensures that her family is able to eat 3 times a day. She hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

Maximiana plans to use her loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. This will help her business and family immensely.

loans.use: buy fishing nets, hooks and fishing materials

loans.name: Payibe

texts.en:
Payibe lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 35 years old, married, and has six children -- all of them are still in school. 

Payibe heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 1000 in order to purchase charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Saliou est un homme marié polygamme avec 3 épouses. Il est père de 8 enfants dont les 5 sont des élèves.Il tient une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires au marché de sa localité. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter du riz, du lait , du sucre et d'autres denrées de première nécessité. Son ambition est d'agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Saliou is a married polygamous man who has three wives. He is a father of eight children, of whom five are students. He has a shop selling grocery items at the market in his town.

In order to bolster his business capital, he is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy some rice, milk, sugar, and other basic goods. His ambition is to expand his store.

loans.use: to buy some rice, milk, sugar, and other basic goods

loans.name: Armando Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 1 maior de idade e 2 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais um tio que vive com ele.

Trabalha como condutor de chapa há mais de 7 anos e tem um salário de 6.300.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 26.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (cimento, pedra, chapas, barrotes, ferro, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de  13.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt, que usou para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e comprar um motor para a sua viatura e aumentar a frota de chapas, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Armando was born in Boane district of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is a married father of three children, one is nearly an adult and the other two are still attending school.  Armando completed school through the fourth grade and had then to stop due to lack of financial support from his parents.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports an uncle who lives with them.

He works as a van driver for the past seven years and has a salary of 6.300.00mt per month, which he applies to household expenses and a small bank account.

He has never had a loan with other banks. He learned of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his third loan from Hluvuku in the amount of 26.000.00mt with which he plans to purchase construction materials for work on his house (cement, stone, slabs, beams, iron, and others). The previous loans were 13.000.00mt and 15.000.00mt that were also used for housing projects.

He is committed to repaying the loan in the future and plans to complete his home and buy a motor for his car to increase his fleet of vans, hopefully with additional Hluvuku loans.

loans.use: To buy cement, rocks, metal sheets, beams, iron, and other materials to expand his home.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Mariana es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive por la parroquia del Valle llamada también “San Bautista de El Valle”  que está situada al sureste de Cuenca. Esta parroquia es famosa por su producción agrícola, también su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, al comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca. El Valle tiene atractivos como la laguna de Cochapamba (llenas de totoras) y varios lugares más para visitar.

La Señora Mariana tiene 55 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, 4 son casados y viven independiente, sus hijos solteros son de 22, 18 y 16 años de edad, su hija de 22 años pasa en casa y ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar y sus dos hijos siguientes trabajan para solventar sus gastos personales. Su esposo es de profesión albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Mariana pasa en casa realizando los quehaceres del hogar y cuida de su familia, también se dedica a criar cuyes, cerdos y pollos a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y  su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y cerdos para crecer en esta actividad. 

Su meta es tener más capital para ser negociante de animales
texts.en:
Mariana is a member of El Cisne Communal Bank.  She lives in the parish of El Valle, also called San Bautista de El Valle, located to the southeast of Cuenca.  This parish is famous for its agricultural production.  The people there also work raising animals and in business, and many work in the city of Cuenca.  El Valle has attractions such as Cochapamba Lake (full of totora reeds) and various other places to visit.

Mariana is 55 years old and married, and has seven children from her marriage.  Four are married and live on their own.  Her single children are 22, 18, and 16.  Her 22-year-old daughter stays at home and helps with the housework and her next two children work to pay for their personal expenses.  Her husband is a bricklayer by profession.  The house they live in is their property. 

Mariana stays at home and does the housework and takes care of her family.  She also works raising guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens, which she sells in her community.

She has been with her communal bank for two years, and she is going to invest her loan in buying chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs to grow in this work.

Her goal is to have more capital to be an animal dealer.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
Servando, age 50, is an entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol.  He is married with two children.

Servando is engaged in farming and fishing.  He primarily grows rice to sell.  Fishing augments his income.  Servando has a monthly income of about 7000 php. 

He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizer and fish traps.  Servando plans to expand and focus on farming.  He also hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fish traps.

loans.name: Matano

texts.en:
Matano Leo is a 34 year old, married, video shop owner in Mombasa.  His business has successfully been in operation for the past six years.

This is his third business loan from KADET LTD . He plans to purchase more video tapes and a new DVD.  He will use the anticipated profits to renovate the video shop and repay his loan. 

He hopes to have well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more video tapes and a new DVD.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is a 36 year-old married man with two children, ages seven and 12.  His wife works as a cashier in a bakeshop. 

Vicente runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business and sells wholesale items at retail prices in Trinidad, Bohol.

Vicente works hard to provide for his family and send his kids to school.  

He requested this loan to purchase gasoline and items at wholesale that he can resell.  Vicente hopes this loan will help improve his businesses.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and items at wholesale that he can resell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old, married, business man who runs a butchery shop.  His wife is a farmer.  They are blessed with two children.  He has been in business for the past ten years, with the monthly income of about KES 5,500, which she uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully.  Joseph will use the loan to buy bulls for slaughtering. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.  His hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy bulls for slaughtering.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a widow she lives with her seven dependents, at Jukwa near Abura.  

Abena sells plantains and Gari (ginger) which she has done for 30 years. 

As a single parent she uses her income to feed and cloth her children.   

She will use her loan to purchase plantains to sell.  With the new profit, Abena hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase plantains to sell.

loans.name: Veronica Yayaa

texts.en:
Veronica Yayaa  is a petty trader at Jukwa near Abura.  She trade pans, gari (ginger), bread, drinks, wigs and other items.  She has been in business for three years.  

Veronica is married to an account clerk  and has two children.  She uses her income to help pay their children’s school fees.  

Veronica will use her loan to purchase hair extensions, drinks and pans to resell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, drinks and pans to resell.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia sells maize at Jukwa near Abura, which she has done for 14 years. 

Afia is married and has three children.  She uses her income to help pay their utility bills. 

Afia will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell.  With the new profit she hopes buy maize in large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Celandia Edelmira

texts.es:
Celandia es una mujer de 41 años, madre de 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años. Juntos viven en la parroquia "Abraham Calazacón" de Santo Domingo, que es la cuarta ciudad con mas población del Ecuador. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. Su temperatura habitual es de unos 25.5°C  y a veces llega a los 38 °C. Toda la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso, toda la provincia es considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Celandia tiene un taller de confección de ropa desde hace 18 años, aprendió este oficio a través de cursos. Ella desea invertir comprando una cortadora de tela y más tela para incrementar su producción, y disminuir costos de producción y como consecuencia incrementar su margen de utilidad. Sus confecciones tienen una buena demanda ya que ella trabaja con calidad. Su sueño es tener un gran taller y poder dar trabajo a más personas. Trabaja un promedio de 9 horas al día.

Ella ama su trabajo, este es su primer crédito con Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre Silvia y los prestamistas a nivel mundial del portal KIVA; sin embargo en la evaluación crediticia ella siempre ha sido puntual es los créditos que ha obtenido anteriormente. Le gusta Fundación Alternativa por la facilidad que ofrece y la atención de su asesor.
texts.en:
Celandia is a 41-year-old woman, the mother of two children, ages 12 and 8.  Together they live in the Abraham Calazacón parish of Santo Domingo, which is the fourth largest city in Ecuador.  The population is growing rapidly because it is rich in trade and has the largest livestock market in the country.  The normal temperature is about 25.5°C and sometimes reaches 38°C.  The entire Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province is part of the mountainous region.  The entire province is considered new because it was created in 2007.

Celandia has had a dressmaking workshop for 18 years.  She learned this job by taking classes.  She wants to buy a fabric cutter and more fabric to increase her production and lower her production costs, and so increase her profit margin.  Her work is in high demand because she works with quality.  Her dream is to have a big workshop and be able to give work to more people.  She works an average of nine hours a day.

She loves her work.  This is her first loan with Fundación Alternativa, which is the intermediary institution between Silvia and the Kiva lenders at the worldwide level.  Nevertheless, in her credit evaluation she always has been punctual with the loans she has received previously.  She likes Fundación Alternativa because of the ease it offers and the service of the advisor.

loans.use: to buy a fabric cutter and fabric.

loans.name: Shoista

texts.ru: Шоиста добросовестная и порядочная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать пятерых детей. Более 14 лет она занимается торговлей. Она продает картофель, лук, капусту и другие сельхозпродукции. Шоиста старается расширить свой бизнес, чтобы улучшить свои жилищные условия. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 2500 Сомони для покупки сельхозпродукции. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Shoista is an honest and decent woman. She is married and is a loving mother of five children. She has been selling for more than fourteen years. She sells potatoes, onions, cabbage and other agricultural crops. Shoista tries to expand her business so that she can improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan with this purpose in the amount of 2,500 somoni to buy vegetables. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is a 61 years old farmer from village Kvirike, West Georgia.  Revaz lives with his family: wife – Zhuzhuna, 33 years old son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (8 and 4 years old). Children go to school/kindergarten.  Zhuzhuna and her daughter-in-law work in a local school as teachers. 

Revaz and his son run an agricultural business, which is their main source of income.  They run a bee-keeping business.  The family owns 50 bee-hives with bee-colonies.  Revaz harvests honey twice a year and sells it at the local market.  His family also owns a citrus garden (.3 hectare).  Revaz and his son also sell their citrus at the local market.  Their total average monthly income is 1200 Laris. 

Revaz requested this loan to purchase sugar so he can feed his bees during early spring.  Also part of the loan will be used to purchase medicine, which is used for seasonal disinfection of his bee-hives.  After properly completed his seasonal work, the family hopes to generate a greater harvest of honey later in the year, and the income from sales will increase. 

Revaz plans to reinvest in his bee-keeping business.  He also hopes to purchase additional bee-hives for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and medicines for bees,

loans.name: Nyameke

texts.en:
Nyameke is married but has no child.  She sells plantains at Jukwa near Abura.  Nyameke has been selling plantains for the past eight years. 

She uses her income to help family bills. 

Nyameke will use her loan to purchase more plantains to sell.  With the new profit, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains to sell.

loans.name: Ferdy

texts.en:
Ferdy, a 58-year-old-man, is married to Katarina, a 59-year-old lady. Ferdy and Katarina are blessed with six children: two are married, three of them are working and the other one is still at school. 

To generate income, Ferdy started a brick business one year ago. His wife also helps him earn extra money by selling vegetables at a traditional market. Prior to running this business, Ferdy used to work part-time as a building contractor but the income he generated from the job depended on customers' orders. With the skill he has, Ferdy runs his business properly. He can produce hundreds of blocks of brick per day. At the moment, Ferdy has received an order for a thousand blocks of brick for building construction. This is a good chance for Ferdy to generate more income; therefore, he requested a loan of 4,500,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM. He would like to spend the loan on cement, sand and soil.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and soil.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells utensils at Jukwa near Abura and has been in business for seven years. 

She is married to a mason and they have two children.  Efua uses her income to help pay their children’s school fees. 

She will need a loan to purchase more utensils to sell.  With the new profit, Efua hope to build a place where she can sell her utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua  is a seamstress.  She is married to a teacher and has 2 children. Akosua has been sewing for 8 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills. Akosua makes dresses for sale so she needs a loan to purchase fabrics for the dresses she makes. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for the dresses she makes

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a seamstress. She is single and lives in Jukwa near Abura.  Felicia has been a seamstress for 2 years now. She is responsible for paying her utility and accomodation bills. Felicia will use her loan to purchase cloth and fabrics for sewing. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 43 years old. She lives in a small village of West Georgia with her big family, husband Levan, two daughters (19 and 20 years old), 8 years old son and mother-in-law. Mzia’s son goes to school and her elder daughter is a student. Her younger daughter plans to enter high school next year. Levan works as a fitter in a local company. Mzia leads the agricultural business of the family. They have a milk cow. Mzia produces cheese and sells it on the local open market. Also the family owns 0.3 hectare of land, where citrus and nuts are grown. Mzia and Levan sell harvested products on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 550 Laris.

Mzia requested credit for renovation of the cattle shed. After renovation, she will be able to keep more cows in the shed, which is impossible now, because of how old and damaged the building is. In the future, Mzia plans to purchase additional milk cows. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. It will have positive impact on the family's income and respectively their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her cattle shed renovation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary  is a hairdresser. She operate a beauty salon which she has done for 11 years now. Mary is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver and they live together at Jukwa near Abura. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children. Mary will use her loan to purchase hair extensions wigs, hair creams, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.  With the new profit, Mary will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, wigs, hair creams, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mauricio Alfredo

texts.es:
Mauricio, vive con sus padres y hermanos, es soltero, se dedica a atender un taller de estructuras metálicas, aprendió por el apoyo de su familia y trabajando en otros talleres, no tiene un horario definido.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de hierro de diferentes medidas, electrodos y pintura, con estos materiales podrá mantener en el taller lo necesario para realizar el trabajo que demanden.
Él quiere tener éxito con esta inversión, prestar un servicio de calidad en sus fabricaciones ya que de esta manera esta asegurando mayores ganancias para el hogar.
texts.en:
Mauricio lives with his parents and brothers. He is single and runs a metalworking shop. He learned his trade from his family and by working in other shops. He does not have a set schedule for his workshop.

He is currently applying for a loan to purchase iron pieces of different sizes, electrical supplies, and paint. He needs these supplies for his workshop, so he can complete projects for his clients. 

He hopes that this investment will succeed. When he is fabricating parts he is sure to do high quality work so that he can earn more money for the household.

loans.use: purchase iron, paint, and electrical supplies for his metalworking shop

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.ru: Мирзо женат и ответственный отец пятерых детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Более 5 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. В бизнесе помогают супруга и сын. Кроме земледелия он занимается выращиванием и продажей мелкого рогатого скота. Мирзо запрашивает займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений, ядохимикатов, горюче-смазочных материалов. Также хочет оплатить за аренду техники.
texts.en: Mirzo is married and is a responsible father of five children. He is a hardworking and kind man. He has been cultivating crops for more than five years. His spouse and son help him in the business. Besides agriculture he breeds and sells small horned cattle. Mirzo is asking for a loan to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, chemicals, fuel and lubricants. He also wants to pay for the lease of the equipment.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, pesticides, fuel and lubricants.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: In the picture, Alice is the woman pounding fufu (starchy dumpling made from cassava). She operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold). She has done this for the past 5 years. The foods she serves are fufu, banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup), and rice balls. She lives together with her husband and 8 dependents. Alice uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase food items and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new profit, Alice plans to operate a restaurant

loans.use: to purchase food items and other ingredient to prepare her food for sale

loans.name: Irma Florinda

texts.es:
La señora Irma Florinda, tiene 22 años de edad, cursó el tercer grado de educacion básica, se dedica a comercio, a la venta de ropa típica para mujeres, inicio siendo trabajadora para otro negocio y hasta el momento llevan 4 años e experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de ropa típica: blusas, cortes, delantales, blusas para su posterior reventa, ya que quiere mejorar sus ventas, y tener un capital amplio.
texts.en:
Irma Florinda is 22 years old, and completed the third grade of primary education.  She works in commerce, selling traditional clothing for women.  A hard worker, she began working for another business and now has 4 years of experience. 

She is requesting a loan to buy traditional clothing: blouses,skirts, aprons, and blouses for subsequent resale, so as to improve her sales and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones Unidos”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos. Ella estudió educación secundaria incompleta.
Trabaja hace siete años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su tienda de abarrotes.
Domitila solicitará un crédito  por la suma de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar  arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, detergentes, golosinas, gaseosas, etc, en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo, también trabaja en otro lugar.
Su sueño para el futuro es agrandar el negocio y  poner una pollería.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Domitila is a member of the community bank "Corazones Unidos" or United Hearts. It is located in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Department of Puno. She is 32 years old, and she lives with her partner and their four children. She reached high school, but did not complete her studies.

She has been working for seven years with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, which she invested in her grocery store.

Domitila is requesting a loan of 3,000 new soles which she will use to purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, detergent, snacks, sodas, and other staple products. Her children and husband help her with the shop, though her husband also works outside the home.

Her dream is to grow her business and one day start a poultry shop.

What she likes most about the community bank is the accessibility of the loans and the opportunity to save.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, detergent, sodas, and other products for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru: Насриддин женат и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Имеет арендованную землю,  где сеет  репчатый лук и более 13 лет занимается этим бизнесом. Супруга помогает ему впосеве семян и обработки земли. Насриддин хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов. Насриддин надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Nasriddin is married and has one child. He rents out the land where he sows onions which has been his business for more than thirteen years. His wife helps him in the sowing of the seeds and processing of the land. Nasriddin wants to take out the loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizer and pesticides. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers an pesticides.

loans.name: Diokel

texts.fr: Diokel est un agriculteur qui pratique en même temps l'élevage.En effet, il achète des boeufs qu'il engraisse pendant 6 mois pour les revendre à de bons prix. Ses deux activités lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de ses deux épouses et de ses 7 enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Afin de renforcer son activité d'élevage, il sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter un boeuf. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: Diokel is a farmer who also raises livestock. He buys cows that he fattens for six months and sells them for a good price. His two jobs allow him to take care of his two wives and seven children, who all go to school. To bolster his livestock business, he is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy a cow. He wants to increase the size of his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima est un éleveur mais aussi un intermédiare dans le commerce de bétail. Il se rend dans les nombreux marchés hebdomadaires de sa région et aide les acheteurs à trouver de bons produits à de bons prix. En plus, il achéte lui même des boeufs qu'il engraisse et revend après 6 mois. Ces deux activités lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille constituée de son épouse et de ses 6 enfants.Pour renforcer son activité d'embouche, il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter 1 boeuf et des aliments de bétail.Il ambitionne de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: Ibrahima raises cattle but he's also a middleman in cattle sales. He takes part in numerous weekly markets in his region and helps buyers find good products for a good price. He also buys cows himself which he fattens and resells after six months. These two jobs enable him to take care of his family, comprised of his wife and six children. To bolster his business, he's requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy one cow and cattle feed. He hopes to build a house for himself.

loans.use: to buy one cow.

loans.name: Diomaye

texts.fr: Diomaye est un homme qui exerce trois activité: la culture hivernale de mil et d'arachide, les cultures maraîchères de légumes en contre saison et l'embouche bovine.Il est marié et père de 7 enfants dont les 5 sont des élèves.La diversité de ses activités lui permet d'obtenir assez de revenus pour subvenir aux besoins alimentaires, sanitaires, vestimentaires et autres de sa famille. Il réussit aussi à épargner un peu pour participer au financement de ses activités.Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter un boeuf et démarrerainsi  une nouvelle opération d'embouche.Il ambitionne de construire une ferme agricole et d'élevage.
texts.en: Diomaye is a man who has three jobs: winter farming of millet and peanuts, truck farming of legumes during the hot and dry season, and raising cattle. He is married and has seven children, five of whom are in school. The diversity of his jobs has enabled him to make enough money to take care of the food, health, clothing, and other needs of his family. He has also succeeded in saving a little so he can finance his businesses. Now, he is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy a cow and start up another livestock raising business. He hopes to build a farm for growing crops and raising livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Demba Kalidou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Demba Kalidou est employé dans une agence de sécurité avec une expérience de 20 ans dans ce domaine. Il a 44 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’ainé est âgé de 8 ans et le plus jeune, 3 ans. Il sollicite l’appui de la caisse pour  rapatrier sa famille qui est présentement à Dakar. Avec  la distance, il dépense beaucoup plus d’argent pour  satisfaire les besoins  de sa famille. Il décide donc de minimiser ses charges et de faire venir  sa femme et les enfants près de lui. Le prêt  va lui permettre de régler les frais du voyage.
Comme projet futur, il voudrait obtenir un financement pour le renforcement de ses activités agricoles car il possède déjà du matériel sur place.
texts.en:
Demba Kalidou is employed in a security company and has 20 years of experience working in this field.  He is 44 years old, married, and has three children ranging between 3 and 8 years old.  He is requesting financial support in order to bring his family over.  His family is currently in Dakar, and because of the distance, Demba Kalidou spends a lot of money to meet his family's needs.  He is therefore trying to reduce his costs and to bring his wife and children closer to him.  This loan will allow him to pay for his family's travel expenses.
His future project is to obtain the necessary funding to strengthen his farming activities, since he already has some equipment on site.

loans.use: to pay travel expenses to bring his family over.

loans.name: Saray Amelia

texts.es: Saray aprendió su oficio como modista desde muy joven cuando arreglaba y confeccionaba para sus familiares. Su esposo nació en el municipio de Sabanagrande, en el departamento del Atlántico, donde es muy conocida por su manera familiar de tratar a quien la conoce. Por eso cuando hace 4 años, decidió ofrecer sus servicios al público lo hizo en el municipio de donde es oriundo su esposo y le fue muy bien. Hoy reside muy cerca al mar, paisaje  que la inspira en su creatividad,   en compañía de  su esposo y sus dos hijos, que se encuentran en las edades de 9 y 10 años. Ella ofrece principalmente los servicios de arreglo de vestidos, blusas, faldas femeninas y en un menor porcentaje, se dedica a elaborar totalmente la prenda. Entre sus planes está ampliar su taller adicionando maquinarias y contratar a una empleada, que apoye su crecimiento. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr esta meta y por eso acude a su credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una maquina y una fileteadora, con la que planea ofrecer un servicio mas efectivo y de mayor calidad a su clientela; mientras esto ocurre continua manejando un margen de utilidad no menor al 60% y una rotación de materias primas de 18 días, razones financieras desde las cuales preveemos su crecimiento.
texts.en: Saray learned the trade of being a dressmaker from a young age when she would mend and tailor clothes for her relatives. Her husband was born in the municipality of Sabanagrande in the department of Atlántico where she is well known for her informal way of interacting with those she knows. Because of this, when she decided to offer her services to the public four years ago, she did it in the municipality where she's from and things have gone well for her. Nowadays she lives very near to the sea, scenery which inspires her with creativity hand in hand with her husband and their two children that are between the ages of 9 and 10 years old. The services she mainly offers are to mend dresses, dress shirts, and female skirts, and to a lesser extent makes a living making garments. Her plans include making her shop bigger, adding sewing machines, and hiring an employee that will support its growth. Currently her work capital is not enough to have this goal succeed and for this reason she turned to a Kiva loan. Also, this is the first financing she has done with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this she will buy a sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine. She plans to offer more effective and better quality service to her customers with these. While this happens she continues to run a utility margin no less than 60% and an 18-day rotation of raw materials, financial reasons because of which we foresee her growth.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Faty

texts.fr:
Née en 1961, Faty s’est mariée très tôt car son ainé a 35 ans et le plus jeune, 8 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits divers, des fruits de la période, du café à l’artisanal. Elle a une expérience de 10 ans dans ce domaine .Avec le crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle veut aller dans un marché hebdomadaire pour acheter des produits alimentaires : du tamarin, des fruits, du café...
Madame Faty n’a pas de charges, mais avec les bénéfices de ses ventes elle épargne et a comme projet futur de construire  sa maison qui est à Touba.
texts.en:
Faty was born in 1961 and got married when she was very young.  Her oldest child is 35 years old.  Her youngest is 8.  
She is actively involved in the sale of various products such as seasonal fruits and organic coffee.  She has a 10-year experience in this field.  
With her requested loan, she wants to go to a weekly market to buy some food products: tamarind, fruits, coffee...
Faty has no expenses.  She is able to save the profits from her sales.  Her future project is to build a house in Touba.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale: seasonal fruits, coffee and various other items.

loans.name: Dilsa

texts.es: Dilsa  empezó como emprendedora desde hace 20 años vendiendo desinfectantes, detergentes y adicionalmente productos plásticos  que le entregaban con descuentos especiales y que ella distribuía en diferentes poblaciones  del departamento del Magdalena. Actualmente viaja 3 veces por semana y especializó su oferta vendiendo productos plásticos a crédito que le pagan    semanalmente. Su meta es poder ayudar a su hijo,  para que obtenga su propia vivienda, por eso trabaja día a día. Su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder a la demanda y esto es justamente lo que busca con un credikiva, lograr obtener mayor capacidad de compra ajustada a pedidos que han realizado sus clientes, para sostenerlos siempre fieles. Con su credikiva comprará sillas plásticas, tanques de almacenamiento de agua, poncheras, baldes, calderos, entre otros artículos, su inversión presume tener éxito porque agregaría a su negocio un nuevo capital de trabajo, con el que comprará artículos que rotarian rápidamente, en la medida en que su respuesta está hecha bajo solicitudes, a las que sus clientes esperan tener respuesta lo mas pronto posible.
texts.en: Dilsa began as an entrepreneur 20 years ago selling disinfectants and detergents in addition to products made of plastic. These were delivered to her with special discounts and she then distributed them to different populations in the department of Magdalena. Currently she travels three times a week and specialized her offer by selling products made from plastic on credit for which she's paid weekly. Her goal is to be able to help her son so that he can have his own home. For this reason she works day after day. Her biggest challenge is having enough work capital to respond to the demand and this is just what she's looking for with a Kiva loan: to succeed in obtaining a greater buying capacity in accordance with the orders that her customers have made and to always keep their business. With her Kiva loan she will buy plastic chairs, water storage containers, punch bowls, buckets, and cauldrons, among other items. Her investment is predicted to be successful because she would add new work capital to her business with which she will buy items that go quickly. This is insofar as it is certain that her response to the demand is made from requests which her customers hope to have an answer to as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs, water storage containers, punch bowls, buckets, and cauldrons, among other items.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Señoras de Taguan, viven por los alrededores de una parroquia perteneciente al cantón Sigsig, lugar que tiene una exuberante vegetación y muchos lugares  para visitar, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y también laboran en las artesanías en especial fabricando sombreros de paja toquilla.
 
Doña María tiene 70 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María pasa en casa en donde se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos y borregos a los que  los vende en su comunidad. También trabaja en la agricultura  y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y el alimento para sus animales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank Señoras de Taguan. They live along the outskirts of a parish church that belongs to the canton Sigsig, a place that has lush vegetation and many places to visit. Her people make a living raising animals, farming, and also work in traditional crafts, especially making Panama hats.

Mrs. María is 70 years old, a widow, and had four children while married, all of whom are older, married, and live independently. The home in which she lives is her own property.

María spends time at home where she makes a living raising livestock, pigs, and sheep which she sells in her community. She also works farming and what she harvests is only for the consumption of her home.

The communal bank was found 2 years ago and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of chicken and food for her animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food for her animals.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: Maria de 59 años de edad tiene un negocio en el centro de la ciudad donde prepara y vende deliciosos almuerzos. Ella llegó a la ciudad procedente de Medellín con su esposo y sus 5 hijos hoy en las edades de 18 a 40 años, inicialmente emprendieron una refresquería, con la que no pudieron continuar pues surgieron problemas familiares que los separó. Ella encargada entonces de sus 5 hijos, debió afrontar duras pruebas para lograr sostenerlos,  pero con su esmero y su persistente trabajo la sacó adelante con su familia. Hoy prepara almuerzos, comidas corrientes en una zona muy comercial de la ciudad y tiene una gran clientela fija;  con sus ingresos logra ingresos para el abastecimiento de su familia, por eso su sueño de crecimiento es inagotable y quiere lograr acondicionarlo efectivamente  para ofrecer un ambiente confortable a su clientela y continuar fidelizándola. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, como arroz, pasta aceite cereales en mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos propios de este estilo de compra. Mientras esto ocurre, maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 8 días, una rentabilidad no menor del 19,5% y un margen de contribución no inferior al 29,67%
texts.en: María, 59 years old, has a business in the center of the city where she makes and sells delicious lunches. She arrived to the city from Medellín with her husband and their 5 children who are now between the ages of 18 and 40 years old. Initially they began a soft drink store that they couldn't continue, thus family problems came up that separated them. In charge of her five children, she had to face difficult tests to succeed in supporting them but with her care and persistent work, she got her family ahead. These days she makes lunches and fast food in a very commercial area of the city and she has a large, fixed clientele. With her income she achieves earnings that support her family. For this reason her dream of growing is inexhaustible and she wants to be able to effectively equip it in order to offer her customers a comfortable environment and continue cultivating their loyalty. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan. This is the first funding that she has done with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with which she will buy raw materials and supplies like rice, pasta, oil, and cereals in greater volume to get discounts from this manner of purchasing. While this happens she is running an account rotation to charge for 8 days, a profitability of no less than 19.5%, and a contribution margin not inferior to 29.6%

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies like rice, pasta, oil, and cereals in greater volume.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es: Maritza tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos, reside en Barrio Corazón de Jesús en el municipio de Campamento y se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y también a la venta de articulos para el hogar. Maritza inicio a vender ropa usada hace 19 años atrás, trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos. Su horario de atencion inicia a las 7:00 a.m y culmina a las 7:00 p.m. Maritza gracias a Dios es una persona sana, muy jovial, amable y muy conocida por sus vecinos. Ella solicita este préstamo para comprar varios fardos de ropa usada y así surtir su negocio de estilos actuales y acordes a la temporada de verano, además necesita comprar articulos para el hogar como ser: comodas y centros de entretenimiento. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá llamar la atención de más clientes y seguirá teniendo una actividad económica que le permita cubrir los gastos para la manutención de su familia. Su sueño es tener un local propio y ayudar a sus hijos a realizarse profesionalmente. Este es el primer financiamiento que obtiene Maritza en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Maritza is 34, married, and the mother of 3 children. She lives in Barrio Corazón de Jesús in the Campamento municipality. She sells second hand clothes and household goods. Maritza started selling clothes 19 years ago. She works together with her children. Her work hours start from 7 am and end at 7 pm. Maritza gives thanks to God that she is healthy, cheerful, friendly, and well known among her neighbors. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase various bundles of used clothes in order to stock her store with the current styles of summer clothes. In addition, she needs to purchase household goods such as chests of drawers and entertainment centers. With the support of this loan, she will be able to attract the attention of more customers and continue having a work that allows her to cover the expenses of maintaining a family. 
Her dream is to have her own store and to help her children realize their professional potential. This is Maritza’s first loan with FAMA and she expects to make the loan payments punctually.

loans.use: Purchase bundles of used clothing and household goods.

loans.name: Maritza Evangelista

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 52 años de Edad, tiene 1 hija y vive en casa propia en el distrito de Morropón, perteneciente a la Región Piura, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
  
Maritza se dedica a brindar el servicio de de transporte de pasajeros en el distrito de la Morropón y campiñas a través de un mototaxi (unidad móvil que consiste en una moto con una cabina para el transporte de pasajeros).  Maritza tiene clientela fija, ya que les da una buena atención cuando los transporta.  Esta actividad le brinda ingresos con los cuales puede solventar sus gastos y los de su familia, por lo que trata de mantenerlo de la mejor manera posible.

Por el uso que le da diariamente al mototaxi, este ha sufrido una serie de desperfectos, que ya ha exigido el pare en la actividad.  Es por ello que para darle mantenimiento al vehículo y no paralizar su trabajo, ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa por 508 nuevos soles.

Maritza posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Maritza, 52, has a daughter and lives in her own house in the district of Morropón which belongs to the Piura region.  It is an agricultural district about four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.

Maritza runs a passenger transport business between the district of Morropón and the countryside.  She has a motor-taxi (a motorcycle with a passenger booth).  Maritza has fixed customers because of the good service she provides.  Her business gives her enough income to support her family and cover expenses, so she does her best to keep it going.

Because of the daily activity, however, the motor-taxi is in need of repairs and unable to continue providing service.  Therefore, in order to provide maintenance and not have to cease with her work, Maritza is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 508 PEN.

She has good personal and work references in her community.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance for her motor-taxi.

loans.name: Nicolasa Candelaria

texts.es: Nicolasa, una mujer de muchos anhelos en la vida y con gran deseo de superarse siempre, expresa que mediante los financiamientos que se le han venido otorgando gracias a la micro-financiera y kiva a podido alcanzar la mayoria de sus metas, en esta nueva oportunidad resalta la razon de su credito; el cual lo invertira en ropa de verano short, camisetas, trajes de baño, toallas, lentes  entre otros articulos, misma inversion que ayudara al engrandecimiento de su tramo ubicado en uno de los mercados de nuestra capital Managua. Su plan a futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y asi de esa manera seguir aportando para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Nicolasa is yearning for constant success. She says that the loans that she was granted by the microfinance industry and Kiva have enabled her to achieve most of her goals. In this new opportunity she explains the purpose of her loan: she will invest it in summer clothing, shorts, shirts, bathing suits, towels, sunglasses, etc. This investment will help her to expand her stall at one of the markets in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. Her plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of her business and thus keep on contributing to the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing.

loans.name: Nelida Lilana

texts.es:
La Señorita. Nelida es socia del banco comunal Señoras de Taguan, viven por los alrededores de una parroquia perteneciente al cantón Sigsig, lugar que tiene una exuberante vegetación y muchos lugares  para visitar, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y también laboran en las artesanías en especial fabricando sombreros de paja toquilla. 

La Señorita Nelida tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su madre quien se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Ella se dedica laborar en la atención al cliente en un local comercial de venta de ropa. Con el crédito anterior a iniciado la cría de cerdos negocio en el que le va bien.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando más cerdos para criar y en alimento para los mismos. El banco comunal le gusta por la rapidez en los créditos los mismos que les permiten emprender en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Miss Nelida is a member of the communal bank "Señoras de Taguan" whose members live in a parish belonging to the Sigsig Canton, a place with exuberant vegetation and many places to visit.  The local people are involved in livestock farming, agriculture and crafts, such as straw hats.

Nelida is 19, single and lives with her mother, a farmer, in their own house.

She works in customer service at a clothing shop.  With her previous loan she started a pig raising business that is going well.

The new loan will be used to buy more pigs and animal feed.  She likes the communal bank because of the easy credit terms that facilitate going into business.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Henry Willian

texts.es:
Henry tiene 21 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene hijos.  Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío Jesús del Valle del Distrito de Tambogrande. Reside en la parte rural  de este distrito y  solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Henry se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como aves de corral, teniendo actualmente 15 pavos, 18 gallinas, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Además cuenta con 0.5 ha de terreno sembrado de limón que cosecha semanalmente. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 02 años. Su conviviente lo apoya en todas sus actividades que realiza.

El destino del crédito será la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio en el mercado local, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Henry, 21, lives with his common-law wife and they have no children.  He lives in his own house in the Jesús del Valle community in the district of Tambogrande.  His house is in the most rural part of the district and the only utility it has is electricity.

Henry raises small farm animals such as poultry, and has 15 turkeys and 18 hens.  When they reach full development he sells them at the local market.  He also has less than an acre of land where he harvests lemons weekly.  He has been in this business for two years and his wife helps with all the work activity.

He plans to use the loan to buy balanced animal feed to improve development so he can get a better price at the local market.  This investment will allow him to keep expanding his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: 3 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “3 DE SEPTIEMBRE” iniciará el decimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Beatriz. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: repostería y cocina, confección en cuero, venta de juguetes y láminas educativas, carpintería, venta de CD y DVD, comerciante de buzos deportivos, artesanía en adornos de automóviles.

La señora Beatriz, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace siete años atrás y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de producción de repostería, que viene trabajando hace años. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su negocio (compra de vitrina, armazón y víveres mismos que serán instalados en el espacio de venta) y que adquirirá de las ferias paceñas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "3 DE SEPTIEMBRE" is beginning its ninth cycle in the Pro Mujer program run by the Collpani Social Center.  The group is comprised of eight members whose board of directors is led by Mrs. Beatriz.  The members are involved in different business activities such as: baking and cooking, leather making, sales of toys and educational materials, carpentry, sales of CD's and DVD's, sports equipment sales and automobile accessories.

Beatriz has been in the communal bank for seven years and has been in the bakery business for several years.  The loan this time is to expand her business (at the trade fair she will buy a display case, shelving and groceries for the sales area).  Her work allows her to support her family.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds saying it is the health and credit training courses.

loans.use: To buy a display case, shelving and groceries.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus hijos, la cual  está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, en un caserío del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino y aves de corral. Ella cría estos animales en unos corrales ambientados cerca de su domicilio alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente  su conviviente posee chacra propia en la cual siembra maíz y frijol, también es peón agrícola en un fundo de banano orgánico en su propio caserío.
Con los ingresos que les brinda este negocio se encargan de sostener la economía de su familia.

El destino del crédito será la compra de calaminas para mejorar el techado de su casa, que se han deteriorado por las constantes lluvias.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo en su economía para mejorar gradualmente la calidad de vida de su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
María, 34, lives with her common-law husband and two children in her own house in the district of Tambogrande, in an agricultural part of the district, in the province of Piura, about three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque Region.

She raises sheep and poultry in farmyards near her house, feeding them natural grains and fodder; and once they reach full development she sells them to merchants who visit the area.  Also, her husband has land where he grows corn and beans.  He also works on an organic banana plantation in his community.  The income they have from their business allows them to support their family economically.

The loan will be used to buy corrugated iron to repair the roof of their house, since it has deteriorated due to the constant rain.

María's goal is to continue growing her business so she can gradually improve her family's quality of life.  The people who know her believe she is a quiet, responsible person.

loans.use: To repair her roof which has deteriorated due to the constant rain in the area.

loans.name: Ndathie

texts.fr: Ndathie est un homme marié  qui s'active dans l'agriculture et l'élevage.Il cultive des champs d'arachide et de mil mais reste confronté à des problèmes de mauvaises production dues à la faible pluviométrie.Il mène ainsi chaque 6 mois une opération d'embouche bovine ou ovine afin d'obtenir des revenus qui lui permettent de nourrir et d'entretenir ses deux épouses et ses enfants dont 3 vont à l'école.Il a déjà obtenu et payé 8 prêts qui ont tous servi à financé cette activité d'embouche. Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un nouveau prêt de 250000f pour acheter un bœuf.Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Ndathie is a married man who is active in agriculture and livestock. He cultivates fields of millet and peanuts but still faces problems of poor production due to low rainfall.

Every six months he initiates a process of fattening sheep or cattle. This generates revenue enabling him to feed and maintain his two wives and his children, of whom three attend school.

He has already obtained and reimbursed eight loans that have all been used to fund this livestock fattening activity.

Today, he is requesting a new 250,000 francs loan to buy a ox. His ambition is to expand his business.

loans.use: buy an ox

loans.name: Yolanda Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda Francisca es soltera, tiene 19 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este trabajo juntos con sus familiares y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos de varios diseños y colores, y mejorar su producción ya que esperas en el futuro tener un capital amplio.
texts.en:
Ms. Yolanda Francisca is single, 19 years of age, and completed six years of primary schooling. She dedicates herself  to weaving, having embarked on this activity with other family members, and so far has accumulated three years of experience.

She is applying for a loan she will use to purchase threads of various designs and colors, to improve her production. In the future she hopes to increase her operating capital.

loans.use:
Comprar hilos para tejido de cortes
Buy thread for fabric weaving

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a hairdresser. She operates a beauty salon, which she has done for four years now. Sophia is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver and they live together in Jukwa near Abura. Sophia uses her income to support her husband to pay their children's school fees. 

Sophia will use her loan to purchase hair wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer. With the new profit, Sophia will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana cooks plantains and bean stew to sell in Jukwa near Abura. She has done this for a year. Nana is married and has two children. Her hushand is a mason. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  

Nana will use her loan to purchase plantains and beans to make food to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase plantains and beans to make into food to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa Fosu cooks eggs to sell. She is married and has three children. Theresa uses her income to support her husband for the general up-keep of their family. 

Theresa will use her loan to purchase more eggs to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
